_meanings:
{@--9@} Milk or 
anything produced from milk (<ab>Ved.</ab>).

{@--3@} <ab>N.</ab>
of a demon killed by Viṣṇu.

a
lump of honey, clotted honey.

having honey
at the first taste; <ls>Ms. 11. 9.</ls>

a sacrificial 
offering of sweet things.

{1} sweet lime, a
kind of citron.

the forest of the 
demon Madhu.

the three sweet things; {%<ab>i. e.</ab>%} sugar,
honey, and clarified butter.

the extracting of 
sweetness or honey.

<ab>N.</ab> of a tree having
red blossoms.

a bee or
a drunkard; {#rAjapriyAH kEraviRyo ramaMte#}
{#maDupEH saha#} <ls>Bv. 1. 126</ls>, <ls n="Bv.">1. 63</ls> (where
both meanings are intended).

{2} the ceremony of receiving a
guest.

one of the
sixteen purificatory Saṃskāras
(which consists in putting a little
honey into the mouth of a new-born
male child).

an 
epithet of a Yogin in the second order.

a kind of drink mixed
with honey.

a kind of 
sweetmeat made of honey, flour, oil, and
ghee.

{1}
<ab>N.</ab> of the forest inhabited by the
demon Madhu where Śatrughna
founded Mathurā.

{2} <ab>N.</ab> of the third day
in the bright half of Śrāvaṇa.

{1} a destroyer 

or collector of honey.

{2} a kind of
bird of prey.
